comment:
“Switching Targets”

Tapping the enemy body or icon
will allow you to change targets.

“Noble Phantasm Details”

Tapping and holding a Noble Phantasm card
will show the detailed effects of that Noble Phantasm.

“Enemy Details”

Tapping and holding an enemy icon 
will show the enemy status details.

“Servant Details”

Tapping a Servant's portrait in battle will let you
check the details of their Noble Phantasm and any status effects.

“Skill Usage Confirmation”

You can choose to hide/show the confirmation window
before each skill use from the Battle Menu.

“Check Battle Drops”

Contents of obtained treasure chests
can be checked from the Battle Menu.

“Quick Chain”

A bonus for using 3 Quick cards.
Additional Critical Stars will be obtained.

“Buster Chain”

A bonus for using 3 Buster cards.
Your attack for that turn will increase.

“Arts Chain”

A bonus for using 3 Arts cards.
NP for all chain members will increase.

“Brave Chain”

A bonus for using 3 of the same Servant's cards.
A 4th card called “Extra Attack” will occur.

“Skipping Death Animation”

A Servant's death animation can be 
skipped by tapping the screen.

“Buster Card”

Command Card with high attack power.

“Arts Card”

Command Card with 
high capabilities of obtaining NP.

“Quick Card”

Command Card with increased
Critical Star drop rate.

“Cancel the Card Selection”

Tapping an already selected card
will cancel that selection.

“Selection Order of Command Cards”

The effects of cards chosen later in the order
will be increased.

“First Command Card Bonus”

The type of card chosen as the first card
will add a bonus effect to the second and subsequent cards.

“Enemy Charge”

When the enemy's Charge Gauge fills up,
they will be able to use powerful attacks.

“Noble Phantasm Card”

Command card usable at NP of 100% or above.
NP will return to 0 after Noble Phantasm is used.

“Master Skill”

Skills usable by Masters that vary by Mystic Code. 
Can be used from the Master Skill menu.

“Class Affinity: Saber”

Sabers are effective against Lancers and weak to Archers.

“Class Affinity: Lancer”

Lancers are effective against Archers and weak to Sabers.

“Class Affinity: Archer”

Archers are effective against Sabers and weak to Lancers.

“Class Affinity: Rider”

Riders are effective against Casters and weak to Assassins.

“Class Affinity: Caster”

Casters are effective against Assassins and weak to Riders.

“Class Affinity: Assassin”

Assassins are effective against Riders and weak to Casters.

“Class Affinity: Berserker”

Berserkers deal higher damage to and take higher damage from all classes other than Shielder, and are weak against Foreigners.

“Class Affinity: Shielder”

Shielders are not affected by affinity from other classes.

“Class Affinity: Ruler”

Rulers are effective against Moon Cancers, weak against Avengers, and take less damage from Sabers, Lancers, Archers, Riders, Casters, and Assassins.

“Change the Battle Speed”

There are options for “Normal” and “High-speed.” 
You can toggle the speed from the Battle Speed menu.

“Appearance of Battle Characters”

Appearance during battle can be changed after Ascension.
Changes can be made from the Servant Details screen.

“Overkill”

A bonus for additional attacks against enemies with 0 HP.
Additional NP and Critical Stars can be obtained.

“Support Servants’Noble Phantasms”

NPC Servants, Friends' Servants, and Servants of Masters who you are Following can use their Noble Phantasm.
Servants cannot use Noble Phantasms if you are not Friends or Following.

“Critical Effects”

When a Critical Hit occurs, 
Attack Power, NP gain rate, and Critical Star drop rate
will all increase.

“Obtaining Bond Points”

After battles, Bond Points increase for all party members.
Voices and profile information are unlocked as Bond Level increases.

“Command Spells”

Command Spells are replenished one stroke per day. 
They are powerful orders that can be issued to your Servants.

“Chain Error”

If there are less than 3 actionable Command Cards, 
you will not be able to gain effects of the chain.

“Servant Skill: Usage”

There are no limits to the number of skills you can use in 1 turn.
Overlapping skills can give greater results.

“Servant Skill: Enhancement”

By increasing a skill's level, not only will it become more powerful,
but the cooldown can be shortened by up to 2 turns.

“Servant Skill: Acquisition”

New skills can be unlocked 
through Ascension.

“Craft Essences”

Can be equipped to Servants to gain various benefits.
Equipment is done through the Party Setup screen.

“Critical Stars”

Distributed to each Command Card.
The chance of a Critical Hit increases with the number of stars.

“Attacking Evade/Invincible Status”

NP gain and Critical Star generation will still occur
when attacking enemies with the Evade or Invincible buffs.

“Distribution of Critical Stars”

The rate of distribution varies by class.
Distribution rate can be adjusted by using 
Craft Essences and skills.

“Critical Star Drop Rate”

Critical Star drops are calculated with each individual hit, 
so attacks with higher hit numbers tend to 
create more Critical Stars.

“Changing Target During Attack Phase”

If the enemy HP falls to 0 and the next attack is from a 
different Servant, then the target will automatically change to another enemy.

“Noble Phantasm Overcharge”

A bonus occurs when using Noble Phantasm at NP of 200% or higher.
The effects gained differ for each Noble Phantasm.

“Noble Phantasm Chain”

A bonus occurs when multiple Noble Phantasm cards are chosen.
Overcharge increases by +100% with each chain.

“Noble Phantasm Level”

Effects will increase depending on the Noble Phantasm Level.
Furthermore, NP can be charged above 100%.

“Distribution of Command Cards”

5 Command Cards will be dealt each turn from the 15-card pool of 3 Servants.
After the pool of 15 cards has been exhausted on turn 3,
the pool will be reshuffled and 5 cards will be dealt from a new pool of 15 cards.

“Class Affinity”

Affinity will greatly change damage dealt or taken.
Affinity will be shown as EFFECTIVE or RESIST on the command card.

“Support Servant”

Support Servants for your Friends or Followers to use can be set from Support Setup in the Formation menu.

“Changing Targets Mid-Battle”

If no Command Cards are selected, 
it is possible to change targets.

“Command Cards and Chain”

Based on the total number of Quick/Arts/Buster cards
within your party, it will be easier to get certain chains.

“Enemy Class Tendency”

By forming a party based on the affinity with 
the enemy class, you can be more advantageous in battles.

“Target Change after Noble Phantasm”

When you defeat an enemy with a Noble Phantasm, 
the target will automatically switch to a different enemy.

“Noble Phantasm Animation Speed”

Noble Phantasm's animation speed can be set to normal even in high-speed mode.
The settings can be changed from the Battle Menu.

“Number of Enemy Actions”

Enemies can perform actions up to 3 times per turn. 
The number of actions taken depends on the type of enemy.

“Sub-Members”

When a starting member has been defeated, 
the Sub-Members will fill in the ranks in the order they were setup.

“Proper Use of Mystic Codes”

By equipping Mystic Codes based on the party's characteristics, 
you can be more advantageous in battles.

“Class Affinity: Avenger”

Avengers are effective against Rulers and weak against Moon Cancers.

“Confirming Currently Equipped Craft Essences”

Tapping a Servant's portrait in battle
will allow you to check the effects of the equipped Craft Essence.

“Special Attack Hit Effects”

There will be a specific hit effect if 
a Special Attack status is triggered when an attack lands.

“NP Gain From Damage”

NP is also gained when you take damage from an enemy.

“Skill Cooldown”

The duration of skill cooldowns are reduced by 1 
when the skill reaches level 6 and 10 respectively.

“Checking Skill Effects During Cooldown”

Tapping the icon of a used skill 
will allow you to check the skill's effect.

“Enemy Class Tendency Display”

The icons showing the quest's enemy class tendency 
are displayed in the order of strategic importance.

“Withdraw”

Withdrawing from a quest can 
be done from the Battle Menu.

“Changing Party Formation”

By changing the formation during Party Edit/Confirmation screen, 
you can move the Support Servant to the Sub-Members section.

“Reviving the Party Members”

When every single party member is incapacitated, you can use Saint Quartz or
Command Spell: Restore Spirit Origin to revive the party with 100% HP and NP.

“Sure Hit”

An attack will hit even if the target has the Evade buff.

“Ignore Invincible”

An attack will hit even if the target has
the Evade or Invincible buff.

“Ignore Defense”

You will ignore the effects of the enemy's
defensive buffs when dealing damage.

“Arts Card Effectiveness Up”

The damage amount and NP gained from Arts cards will increase.

“Buster Card Effectiveness Up”

The damage amount from Buster cards will increase.

“Quick Card Effectiveness Up”

The damage amount, NP gained, and Critical Star drop rate
from Quick cards will increase.

“Noble Phantasm Strength Up”

Noble Phantasm damage amount will increase.

“Critical Up”

The damage amount dealt by a Critical Hit will increase.

“Damage Cut”

A set value of damage will be mitigated.

“Debuff Resist Up”

The chance of receiving Mental Debuffs and Attack Debuffs will decrease.

“The Appearance of Command Cards”

You will be able to change how Command Cards look after Ascension.
This can be changed from the Servant Details screen.

“C. Star Gather Up”

The distribution rate of Critical Stars is increased.

“C. Star Gain Status”

You will gain a set amount of Critical Stars at the end of each player turn.

“Death”

There is a chance to instantly kill the target.
Resistance to Death depends on the enemy type.

“Special Attack Status”

Damage against certain target types such as “Divine” or “Saber” will increase.

“Special Defense Status”

Damage from certain target types such as “Humanoid” or “Dragon” will decrease.

“HP Recover Up”

The amount of HP recovered when a healing effect is used will increase.

“C. Star Drop Rate Up”

Critical Star drop rate per attack will increase.

“NP Gain Up”

The amount of NP gained through attacks or taking damage will increase.

“Guts Status”

When your HP falls to 0, you will be revived with a portion of HP restored.
Guts Status cannot be stacked.

“MISS”

When a skill's effect fails to trigger 
due to the effect's probability.

“NO EFFECT”

When the skill's effect fails to trigger 
due to certain conditions or overlapping effects.

“Changing Targets”

You can change targets even during 
Command Spells or Skills' effect animations.

“Checking ATK Value”

Tapping the Servant's portraits in battle
will allow you to check the Servant's ATK value.

“Damage Dealt Plus”

A set value will be added to damage dealt.

“ATK Up”

A positive adjustment will be done to the target's ATK.

“DEF Up”

A negative adjustment will be done to the attacker's ATK.

“Servant Skill: Rank Up”

Some Rank Up Quests and Interludes will enhance
a certain skill's effect upon completion.

"NP Enhancement"

Some Noble Phantasms' effectiveness will be enhanced as a reward for completing Rank Up Quests or Interludes.

“Alignment”

Each Servant's Alignment, such as Lawful or Chaotic, can be
checked from the Servant's Profile screen.

“Enemies With Multiple HP Gauges”

Certain powerful enemies possess multiple HP gauges.
Deplete their HP gauge multiple times in order to defeat them.

“Overgauge”

When attacking an enemy with multiple HP gauges,
attacks dealt after one HP gauge has been depleted will receive
a bonus to NP gain and C. Star generation.

“Craft Essence Enhancement”

Enhance Craft Essences to give the equipped Servant
a larger HP or ATK bonus.

“Hero Crystal”

Use Hero Crystals in Servant Enhancement
to increase a Servant's HP or ATK.

“Craft Essence Limit Breakthrough”

Raise a Craft Essence to Maximum Limit Breakthrough
to dramatically strengthen its associated skill.

“Event Bonus Filter”

Use this filter to display only those Servants and Craft Essences
which receive an event bonus.

“Select Support: Unknown”

Servants displayed as “Unknown” are key to the story.
Their identities will be revealed during the quest.

“Select Support: Refresh”

Choose Refresh List on the Select Support screen to refresh the list of available Support Servants.

“Mystic Code Selection”

A specific Mystic Code can be set for each party.
You can change the selection from the “Party Setup”
and “Confirm Party” screens.

“Quest Information”

Tap the button on the bottom left corner of a quest banner
to display previously encountered enemies and dropped items.

“Class Affinity: Alter Ego”

Alter Egos are effective against Foreigners, deal high damage to Riders, Casters, and Assassins, and deal less damage to Sabers, Lancers, and Archers.

"Class Affinity: Moon Cancer"

Moon Cancers are effective against Avengers and weak against Rulers.

"Unlock Wardrobe"

After acquiring the Wardrobe Key and fulfilling certain conditions, a new Spiritron Dress can be unlocked and changed into for battle.

"Hero Crystal: ★4 Fou"

★4 Meteor Fou and Corona Fou allow Servants' HP and ATK to be strengthened to a maximum of 2,000.

"Saving and Switching Party Setups"

A maximum of 10 parties can be created, and once a party is set, it can be switched for another party by swiping left or right.

"NP and Skill Enhancement"

NP and Skills that can be enhanced with Rank Up Quests or Interludes can be verified by going to the "Servant Detail" screen.

"Servant Skills: Details"

During battle or when selecting a Support Servant, pressing and holding the Skill icon will show detailed information.

"Palingenesis"

You can further increase the level of a Servant who has reached Final Ascension, up to a maximum of 100.

"Master Skill: Cooldown"

After a Master Skill is used, its cooldown is displayed on the Master Skill icon.

"Special Battle Drops"

When a special battle reward is obtained, a special animation will play when the treasure chest is opened.

“Class Affinity: Foreigner”

Foreigners are effective against Berserkers, weak against Alter Egos, and deal higher damage to and take higher damage from Foreigners.
